lines.text: Enter DIOMEDES

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: What, are you up here, ho speak.

lines.speaker: calchas
lines.text: [Within]  Who calls

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Calchas, I think. Wheres your daughter

lines.speaker: calchas
lines.text: [Within]  She comes to you. Enter TROILUS and ULYSSES, at a distance after them, THERSITES

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Stand where the torch may not discover us.
Enter CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Cressid comes forth to him.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: How now, my charge!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Now, my sweet guardian! Hark, a word with you.
Whispers

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Yea, so familiar!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: She will sing any man at first sight.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: And any man may sing her, if he can take her cliff shes noted.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Will you remember

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Remember! yes.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Nay, but do, then And let your mind be coupled with your words.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: What should she remember

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: List.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Roguery!

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Nay, then,

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Ill tell you what,

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Foh, foh! come, tell a pin: you are forsworn.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: In faith, I cannot: what would you have me do

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: A juggling trick,to be secretly open.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: What did you swear you would bestow on me

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath Bid me do any thing but that, sweet Greek.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Good night.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Hold, patience!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: How now, Trojan!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Diomed,

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: No, no, good night: Ill be your fool no more.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Thy better must.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Hark, one word in your ear.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: O plague and madness!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: You are moved, prince let us depart, I pray you, Lest your displeasure should enlarge itself To wrathful terms: this place is dangerous The time right deadly I beseech you, go.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Behold, I pray you!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Nay, good my lord, go off: You flow to great distraction come, my lord.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: I pray thee, stay.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: You have not patience come.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: I pray you, stay by hell and all hells torments I will not speak a word!

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: And so, good night.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Nay, but you part in anger.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Doth that grieve thee O witherd truth!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Why, how now, lord!

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: By Jove, I will be patient.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Guardian!why, Greek!

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Foh, foh! adieu you palter.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: In faith, I do not: come hither once again.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: You shake, my lord, at something: will you go You will break out.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: She strokes his cheek!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Come, come.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Nay, stay by Jove, I will not speak a word: There is between my will and all offences A guard of patience: stay a little while.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: How the devil Luxury, with his fat rump and potatofinger, tickles these together! Fry, lechery, fry!

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: But will you, then

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: In faith, I will, la never trust me else.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Give me some token for the surety of it.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Ill fetch you one.
Exit

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: You have sworn patience.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Fear me not, sweet lord I will not be myself, nor have cognition Of what I feel: I am all patience.
Reenter CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Now the pledge now, now, now!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: O beauty! where is thy faith

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: My lord,

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: I will be patient outwardly I will.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: You look upon that sleeve behold it well. He loved meO false wench!Givet me again.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Whose wast

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: It is no matter, now I havet again. I will not meet with you tomorrow night: I prithee, Diomed, visit me no more.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Now she sharpens: well said, whetstone!

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: I shall have it.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: What, this

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Ay, that.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: O, all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge! Thy master now lies thinking in his bed Of thee and me, and sighs, and takes my glove, And gives memorial dainty kisses to it, As I kiss thee. Nay, do not snatch it from me He that takes that doth take my heart withal.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: I had your heart before, this follows it.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: I did swear patience.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: You shall not have it, Diomed faith, you shall not Ill give you something else.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: I will have this: whose was it

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: It is no matter.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Come, tell me whose it was.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Twas ones that loved me better than you will. But, now you have it, take it.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Whose was it

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: By all Dianas waitingwomen yond, And by herself, I will not tell you whose.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Tomorrow will I wear it on my helm, And grieve his spirit that dares not challenge it.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Wert thou the devil, and worest it on thy horn, It should be challenged.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Well, well, tis done, tis past: and yet it is not I will not keep my word.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Why, then, farewell Thou never shalt mock Diomed again.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: You shall not go: one cannot speak a word, But it straight starts you.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: I do not like this fooling.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Nor I, by Pluto: but that that likes not you pleases me best.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: What, shall I come the hour

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Ay, come:O Jove!do come:I shall be plagued.

lines.speaker: diomedes
lines.text: Farewell till then.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Good night: I prithee, come. Troilus, farewell! one eye yet looks on thee But with my heart the other eye doth see. Ah, poor our sex! this fault in us I find, The error of our eye directs our mind: What error leads must err O, then conclude Minds swayd by eyes are full of turpitude.
Exit DIOMEDES
Exit

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: A proof of strength she could not publish more, Unless she said  My mind is now turnd whore.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Alls done, my lord.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: It is.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Why stay we, then

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: To make a recordation to my soul Of every syllable that here was spoke. But if I tell how these two did coact, Shall I not lie in publishing a truth Sith yet there is a credence in my heart, An esperance so obstinately strong, That doth invert the attest of eyes and ears, As if those organs had deceptious functions, Created only to calumniate. Was Cressid here

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: I cannot conjure, Trojan.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: She was not, sure.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Most sure she was.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Nor mine, my lord: Cressid was here but now.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Let it not be believed for womanhood! Think, we had mothers do not give advantage To stubborn critics, apt, without a theme, For depravation, to square the general sex By Cressids rule: rather think this not Cressid.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: What hath she done, prince, that can soil our mothers

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Nothing at all, unless that this were she.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Will he swagger himself out ons own eyes

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: This she no, this is Diomeds Cressida: If beauty have a soul, this is not she If souls guide vows, if vows be sanctimonies, If sanctimony be the gods delight, If there be rule in unity itself, This is not she. O madness of discourse, That cause sets up with and against itself! Bifold authority! where reason can revolt Without perdition, and loss assume all reason Without revolt: this is, and is not, Cressid. Within my soul there doth conduce a fight Of this strange nature that a thing inseparate Divides more wider than the sky and earth, And yet the spacious breadth of this division Admits no orifex for a point as subtle As Ariachnes broken woof to enter. Instance, O instance! strong as Plutos gates Cressid is mine, tied with the bonds of heaven: Instance, O instance! strong as heaven itself The bonds of heaven are slippd, dissolved, and loosed And with another knot, fivefingertied, The fractions of her faith, orts of her love, The fragments, scraps, the bits and greasy relics Of her oereaten faith, are bound to Diomed.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: May worthy Troilus be half attachd With that which here his passion doth express

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Ay, Greek and that shall be divulged well In characters as red as Mars his heart Inflamed with Venus: never did young man fancy With so eternal and so fixd a soul. Hark, Greek: as much as I do Cressid love, So much by weight hate I her Diomed: That sleeve is mine that hell bear on his helm Were it a casque composed by Vulcans skill, My sword should bite it: not the dreadful spout Which shipmen do the hurricano call, Constringed in mass by the almighty sun, Shall dizzy with more clamour Neptunes ear In his descent than shall my prompted sword Falling on Diomed.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Hell tickle it for his concupy.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false! Let all untruths stand by thy stained name, And theyll seem glorious.

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: O, contain yourself Your passion draws ears hither.
Enter AENEAS

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: I have been seeking you this hour, my lord: Hector, by this, is arming him in Troy Ajax, your guard, stays to conduct you home.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Have with you, prince. My courteous lord, adieu. Farewell, revolted fair! and, Diomed, Stand fast, and wear a castle on thy head!

lines.speaker: ulysses
lines.text: Ill bring you to the gates.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Accept distracted thanks.
Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS, and ULYSSES

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would croak like a raven I would bode, I would bode. Patroclus will give me any thing for the intelligence of this whore: the parrot will not do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab. Lechery, lechery still, wars and lechery nothing else holds fashion: a burning devil take them!
Exit
